Starting and Stopping Communication and Acquisition

Function Documentation

int DisableBuffering ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Maintain communication between User Unit and Computer Unit, and continue to service serial port, but disable buffering of DAQ data. Acquisition should be started when DisableBuffering() called. TransferBuffer() and Read...() functions need not (and should not) be called while buffering is disabled.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
success (1) or no device object at handle (-1)
int EnableBuffering ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Re-enable buffering of DAQ data. Duration during which buffering was disabled will not be padded. Acquisition should be started when EnableBuffering() called.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
success (1) or no device object at handle (-1)
int StartAcq ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
char  DisplayProgressDialog 
)

Begin communicating with User Unit and start acquiring data. Communication must be started.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
DisplayProgressDialog(boolean) whether to display progress dialog during start
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
int StartCommunication ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
char *  PortName 
)

Open specified port and begin communicating with BioRadio Computer Unit.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
PortNameport to which BioRadio is connected, ex., "COM3"
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
int StopAcq ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Stop data acquisition and communication with User Unit. Acquisition should be started when called.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
int StopCommunication ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Stop communication with Computer Unit and close COM port. Communication should be started when called.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
